nodes.title: NextUI users can now set borderRadius:0 for card.Body and card.image
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: This PR fixes #301
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
borderRadius: 0 is now available to use for Card.Body and Card.Image

commit.message: Made it possible to use borderRadius 0 for card body and card image
Made Few Changes As per reviewer
minor code changes
Removed Unwanted Comments

```
    position: 'absolute',
    top: 0,
    left: 0,
    right: 0,
    bottom: 0,
    zIndex: '$2',
    transition: '$default'
    size: '100%'
```

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -264,32 +264,36 @@ import { Avatar } from '@nextui-org/react';
 
 #### Avatar Props
 
-| Attribute        | Type                    | Accepted values                          | Description                            | Default   |
-| ---------------- | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | --------- |
-| **color**        | `NormalColors` `string` | [NormalColors](#normal-colors)           | Change avatar color                    | `default` |
-| **textColor**    | `SimpleColors` `string` | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)           | Change avatar text color               | `default` |
-| **src**          | `string`                | -                                        | Image source (local or remote)         | -         |
-| **text**         | `string`                | -                                        | Display text when image is missing     | -         |
-| **alt**          | `string`                | -                                        | Display alt text when image is missing | -         |
-| **size**         | `NormalSizes` `number`  | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes)             | Avatar size                            | `medium`  |
-| **bordered**     | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Bordered avatar                        | `false`   |
-| **borderWeight** | `NormalWeights`         | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)         | Border weight for `bordered` avatar    | `normal`  |
-| **pointer**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Display pointer cursor on hover        | `false`   |
-| **stacked**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Stacked display group                  | `false`   |
-| **zoomed**       | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Zoomed avatar                          | `false`   |
-| **squared**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Squared avatar                         | `false`   |
-| **icon**         | `ReactNode`             | -                                        | Show icon in avatar                    | -         |
-| ...              | `ImgHTMLAttributes`     | `'alt', 'crossOrigin', 'className', ...` | Native props                           | -         |
+| Attribute        | Type                           | Accepted values                          | Description                            | Default   |
+| ---------------- | ------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | --------- |
+| **color**        | `NormalColors` `string`        | [NormalColors](#normal-colors)           | Change avatar color                    | `default` |
+| **textColor**    | `SimpleColors` `string`        | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)           | Change avatar text color               | `default` |
+| **src**          | `string`                       | -                                        | Image source (local or remote)         | -         |
+| **text**         | `string`                       | -                                        | Display text when image is missing     | -         |
+| **alt**          | `string`                       | -                                        | Display alt text when image is missing | -         |
+| **size**         | `NormalSizes` `number`         | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes)             | Avatar size                            | `medium`  |
+| **bordered**     | `boolean`                      | `true/false`                             | Bordered avatar                        | `false`   |
+| **borderWeight** | `NormalWeights`                | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)         | Border weight for `bordered` avatar    | `normal`  |
+| **pointer**      | `boolean`                      | `true/false`                             | Display pointer cursor on hover        | `false`   |
+| **stacked**      | `boolean`                      | `true/false`                             | Stacked display group                  | `false`   |
+| **zoomed**       | `boolean`                      | `true/false`                             | Zoomed avatar                          | `false`   |
+| **squared**      | `boolean`                      | `true/false`                             | Squared avatar                         | `false`   |
+| **icon**         | `ReactNode`                    | -                                        | Show icon in avatar                    | -         |
+| **css**          | `Stitches.CSS`                 | -                                        | Override Default CSS style             | -         |
+| **as**           | `keyof JSX.IntrinsicElements`  | -                                        | Changes which tag component outputs    | `span`    |
+| ...              | `ImgHTMLAttributes`            | `'alt', 'crossOrigin', 'className', ...` | Native props                           | -         |

[Collapse]

 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context



See issue.
Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: feat(collapse) add keyCodes prop
fix(collapse) fix rename typo
chore(collapse) change keyCodes to eventKeyCodes

nodes.body: Okay, I'll change it to `eventKeyCodes` then.

Hey @gillescoolen I appreciate your effort in sending this PR, however, as we are currently integrating `@react-aria` to NextUI components this won't be necessary, would you like to integrate [@react-aria/accordion](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/blob/main/packages/%40react-aria/accordion/src/useAccordion.ts) ?

Hey @gillescoolen thanks for your contribution, however, I'll close this PR due to we already implemented a solution https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/350/files, we have another branch for migrating the `Collapse` component to `@react-aria/accordion` https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/tree/refactor/collapse-react-aria, let me know if you want yo continue that work 🙌🏻

nodes.bodyText:
Nice feature, but keyCodes prop name isn't a good experience for developers imo. What does this keyCode for? is it for navigation? is it for something else? yes, we can understand this by reading the code, it adds keycodes for collapse/open events, but how would a regular developer know this (without looking at to docs ofc)
collapseKeys, keys, collapseCodes, eventKeys, eventKeyCodes prop names would be good, just an opinion.

nodes.title: fix(button): Change the default of Button type props
nodes.bodyText:
[nextui]/[button]
TASK: #274
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

Add type to defaultProps of Button component
Change the default of type props in the Button component documentation to button


Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix(docs): Change the default of Button type props
feat: Add type to defaultProps of Button component
chore: Change the default of type props in the Button component docs to 'button'

nodes.body:
Hey @TokiyaHorikawa thanks for your contribution, however it looks like this is a misunderstanding, the way to fix this is by creating a new `Button` prop called `type` and set `button` value by default 

Here's a detailed implementation

react/src/button/button.tsx

```tsx
export interface Props {
  ...
  type?: React.ButtonHTMLAttributes<HTMLButtonElement>['type'];
}
```


```tsx
const defaultProps = {
...
type: 'button'
...
}
```

Then we have to change the `Button` documentation and set `button` as the default value for the `type` prop, looking forward to this 🙌🏻

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,333 @@
+---
+title: 'Image'
+description: 'The Image component is used to display the images '
+url: https://nextui.org/docs/components/image
+---
+
+# Image
+
+The Image component is used to display the images.
+
+```jsx
+import { Image } from '@nextui-org/react';
+```
+
+<CarbonAd />
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+<Playground
+  title="Default"
+  desc="You can display an avatar with just text or image"
+  code={`
+ <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Image src="/avatars/avatar-1.png" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar squared text="Junior" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar squared src="/avatars/avatar-3.png" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar squared text="Jane" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar squared src="/avatars/avatar-6.png" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar squared text="Joe" />
+    </Grid>
+</Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Sizes"
+  desc="The `Avatar` comes in 5 sizes and you can also set a custom size in px with `size` property."
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="JR" size="xs" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar src="/avatars/avatar-2.png" size="sm" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Joe" size="md" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar src="/avatars/avatar-4.png" size="lg" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="John" size="xl" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar src="/avatars/avatar-1.png" css={{ size: "$20" }} />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Colors"
+  desc="You can change the color with `color` prop"
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Primary" color="primary" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Secondary" color="secondary" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="S" color="success" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Warn" color="warning" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Err" color="error" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar text="Grad" color="gradient" textColor="white" />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Bordered"
+  desc="You can change the full style to a bordered `Avatar` with the `bordered` property."
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-6.png" color="primary" bordered />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-2.png" color="secondary" bordered/>
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-1.png" color="success" bordered />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-4.png" color="warning" bordered />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-5.png" color="error" bordered />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-7.png" color="gradient" bordered />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Zoomed"
+  desc="You can apply a zoom animation to avatar with the `zoomed` property."
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-6.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-2.png" zoomed/>
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-1.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-4.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-5.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-7.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-8.png" zoomed />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Squared"
+  desc="You can change the full style to a squared `Avatar` with the `squared` property."
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-6.png" color="primary" bordered squared />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-2.png" color="secondary" bordered squared/>
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-1.png" color="success" bordered squared />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-4.png" color="warning" bordered squared />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-5.png" color="error" bordered squared />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+        <Avatar size="lg" src="/avatars/avatar-7.png" color="gradient" bordered squared />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Icon"
+  desc="NextUI doesn't use any library or icon font by default, with this we give the freedom to use the one you prefer. In the following example we use [Boxicons](https://boxicons.com/)"
+  code={`
+  <Grid.Container gap={2}>
+    <Grid>
+     <Avatar
+        squared
+       
+        icon={<Sun size={20} fill="currentColor"/>}
+      />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+      <Avatar
+        squared
+        icon={<Moon size={20} fill="currentColor"/>}
+      />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+      <Avatar
+        squared
+        icon={<Video size={20} fill="currentColor" />}
+      />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+      <Avatar
+        squared
+        icon={<VolumeUp size={20} fill="currentColor" />}
+      />
+    </Grid>
+    <Grid>
+      <Avatar
+        squared
+        icon={<Microphone size={20} fill="currentColor"/>}
+      />
+    </Grid>
+ </Grid.Container>
+`}
+/>
+
+<Playground
+  title="Group"
+  desc="You can group several avatars with the parent component `Avatar.Group`"
+  code={`
+  () => {
+    const nameUsers = ['Junior', 'Jane', 'W', 'John', 'JR'];
+    const pictureUsers = [
+        '/avatars/avatar-1.png',
+        '/avatars/avatar-2.png',
+        '/avatars/avatar-3.png',
+        '/avatars/avatar-4.png',
+        '/avatars/avatar-5.png',
+    ];
+    return (
+    <Grid.Container gap={1}>
+     <Grid xs={12}>
+        <Avatar.Group count={12}>
+            {nameUsers.map((name, index) => (
+            <Avatar key={index} size="lg" pointer text={name} stacked />
+            ))}
+        </Avatar.Group>
+      </Grid>
+      <Grid xs={12}>
+        <Avatar.Group count={12}>
+            {pictureUsers.map((url, index) => (
+            <Avatar key={index} size="lg" pointer src={url} bordered color="gradient" stacked />
+            ))}
+        </Avatar.Group>
+      </Grid>  
+    </Grid.Container>
+    );
+ }
+`}
+/>
+
+<Spacer y={3} />
+
+### APIs
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+#### Avatar Props
+
+| Attribute        | Type                    | Accepted values                          | Description                            | Default   |
+| ---------------- | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | --------- |
+| **color**        | `NormalColors` `string` | [NormalColors](#normal-colors)           | Change avatar color                    | `default` |
+| **textColor**    | `SimpleColors` `string` | [SimpleColors](#simple-colors)           | Change avatar text color               | `default` |
+| **src**          | `string`                | -                                        | Image source (local or remote)         | -         |
+| **text**         | `string`                | -                                        | Display text when image is missing     | -         |
+| **alt**          | `string`                | -                                        | Display alt text when image is missing | -         |
+| **size**         | `NormalSizes` `number`  | [NormalSizes](#normal-sizes)             | Avatar size                            | `medium`  |
+| **bordered**     | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Bordered avatar                        | `false`   |
+| **borderWeight** | `NormalWeights`         | [NormalWeights](#normal-weights)         | Border weight for `bordered` avatar    | `normal`  |
+| **pointer**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Display pointer cursor on hover        | `false`   |
+| **stacked**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Stacked display group                  | `false`   |
+| **zoomed**       | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Zoomed avatar                          | `false`   |
+| **squared**      | `boolean`               | `true/false`                             | Squared avatar                         | `false`   |
+| **icon**         | `ReactNode`             | -                                        | Show icon in avatar                    | -         |
+| ...              | `ImgHTMLAttributes`     | `'alt', 'crossOrigin', 'className', ...` | Native props                           | -         |
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+#### Avatar Group Props
+
+| Attribute    | Type             | Accepted values                  | Description                             | Default |
+| ------------ | ---------------- | -------------------------------- | --------------------------------------- | ------- |
+| **count**    | `number`         | -                                | Total count of avatars                  | -       |
+| **animated** | `boolean`        | -                                | Display translations animation on hover | `false` |
+| ...          | `HTMLAttributes` | `'id', 'name', 'className', ...` | Native props                            | -       |
+
+<Spacer y={2} />
+
+### Avatar types
+
+<Spacer y={1} />
+
+#### Normal Colors
+
+```ts
+type NormalColors =
+  | 'default'
+  | 'primary'
+  | 'secondary'
+  | 'success'
+  | 'warning'
+  | 'error'
+  | 'gradient';
+```
+
+#### Simple Colors
+
+```ts
+type SimpleColors =
+  | 'default'
+  | 'primary'
+  | 'secondary'
+  | 'success'
+  | 'warning'
+  | 'error';
+```
+
+```ts
+type NormalSizes = 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl';
+```
+
+#### Normal Weights
+
+```ts
+type NormalWeights = 'light' | 'normal' | 'bold' | 'extrabold' | 'black';
+```

nodes.title: Staging
nodes.bodyText:
[nextui]/[button]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

In order to provide better cross-browser accessibility, the button focus behaviour was migrated to  @react-aria/focus
shadow button was split to avoid using the addColorAlpha function since it does not work on SSR
flat colour contrast improved,  addColorAlpha function  removed due to it does not work on SSR
code contrast ratio color fixed on light mode




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: refactor(button): button focus migrated to @react-aria/focus
fix(nextui): missing aria focus dependency added
feat(link): text color added as a new link color
feat(nextui): addColorAlpha replaced by theme shadow colors
Merge branch 'staging' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/changing-focus-visible-to-react-aria
fix(theme): shadow keys added, code contrast ratio on light moded fixed

Merge pull request #236 from nextui-org/feat/changing-focus-visible-to-react-aria

refactor(button): button focus migrated to @react-aria/focus

nodes.title: Staging
nodes.bodyText:
Staging merge
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context



Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix(collapse): control and label id mismatch solved
refactor(button): capitalized removed
fix(docs): typos and buttons text
chore(text): unnecessary fragment removed
Typo in object

Merge pull request #264 from nextui-org/refactor/button-capitalized

Refactor/button capitalized

Merge pull request #263 from nextui-org/fix/collapse-label-id-ssr

Fix/collapse label id ssr
Merge branch 'main' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into staging

Merge pull request #262 from humbertovnavarro/patch-1

Typo in object
Merge branch 'staging' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into staging
fix(modal): stories

nodes.title: Fix/documentation issues
nodes.bodyText:
[docs]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
docs typos, clear examples, inline styles removed



Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: fix: docs typos, clear examples, inline styles removed
Merge branch 'staging' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into fix/documentation-issues
chore(docs): left sidebar vertical padding increased

nodes.title: refactor(button): button focus migrated to @react-aria/focus
nodes.bodyText:
[nextui]/[button]
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

In order to provide better cross-browser accessibility, the button focus behaviour was migrated to  @react-aria/focus
shadow button was split to avoid using the addColorAlpha function since it does not work on SSR
flat colour contrast improved,  addColorAlpha function  removed due to it does not work on SSR
code contrast ratio color fixed on light mode




Screenshots - Animations

commit.message: refactor(button): button focus migrated to @react-aria/focus
fix(nextui): missing aria focus dependency added
feat(link): text color added as a new link color
feat(nextui): addColorAlpha replaced by theme shadow colors
Merge branch 'staging' of github.com:nextui-org/nextui into feat/changing-focus-visible-to-react-aria
fix(theme): shadow keys added, code contrast ratio on light moded fixed

nodes.title: Full width prop for Button component.
nodes.bodyText:
[react]/[Button]
TASK:
Types of changes

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context

Added the prop fullWidth to the Button component.
Updated Components documentation to include an example of a button with the fullWidth prop.

This allows the user to make the button full width of its container without needing css={{ width: "100%" }} whilst also being able to use the size prop for height and font size.

Screenshots - Animations
Storybook preview:


Documentation preview:

commit.message:
feat: :sparkles: fullWidth prop

Added fullWidth boolean prop

feat: :sparkles: fullWidth prop styling

When the fullWidth prop is true width: 100% is applied, when false it's set to auto

test: :white_check_mark: fullWidth test

Added fullWidth button to the "should render different variants" test

docs: :memo: Add fullWidth button to sizes

Added the fullWidth button to the Sizes function

docs: :memo: Full width button to docs

Added the full width button to the button Sizes documentation.
Merge branch 'main' into ful-width-button

+    <Button fullWidth>full width</Button>
 </>
 `}

nodes.title: Fix - Make the titles of the card components under "Primary Action" r…
nodes.bodyText:
Card component examples in docs.
Fixes: #217
Types of changes

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
I made changes to the example Card components on the website.
The titles of the cards under the "Primary Action" section were not responsive on moible. I added flex-wrap to break it on a new line when viewing on mobile.
The cards under the section "With Footer" and "With Divider" were also not responsive on mobile. I made the width responsive so that it scales with the screen size.
Screenshots - Animations

After:

Before:

After:

Before:

After:

commit.message: Fix - Make the titles of the card components under "Primary Action" responsive by using flex wrap. Make the width of the cards under the "With Footer" and "With Divider" section responsive.
Fix - Change grid from width:100% to sm={12} md={5}

nodes.title: Using Next Link component instead of router.push
nodes.bodyText:
[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: Using the router by Next.js and onClick  handler defeats the whole purpose of links and removes all the accessibility. This PR replaces all router.push uses to the Link component by Nextjs which provides the accessibility like Open in New Tab/Window, etc. And showing where the link will go when clicked.
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context
If we compare the current behaviour with the Next link, it changes a lot of things
One of those differences is the right-click. Right now if we right click this is what shows up 👇.

But actually, we want this 👇

nodes.title: Theme change button not work at first click
nodes.bodyText:
localStorage.getItem("theme") checking is null or undefined in first render
that's why i set default dark at render

[LEVEL]/[COMPONENT]
TASK: 
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 Documentation Only
 Refactor

Description, Motivation and Context



Screenshots - Animations

commit.message:
Theme change button not work at first click

> localStorage.getItem("theme") checking is null or undefined in first render   
that's why i set default dark at render

nodes.body: Hey @techhjork thanks for your contribution, however the problem was fixed here -> https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/pull/209 and it's pending releasing

nodes.bodyText:
I think the issue is not 'not having the theme attributed localstorage item'
When i remove the 'theme' localstorage item, it adds the item and gives 'system' value.
Then when i try to switch the theme, it doesnt change on first click but does on second.
Also, if you switch the theme from here (also you can open it with ⌃K): https://i.imgur.com/vlpgY1a.png
The theme button will be useless on first click.

nodes.body:
Just to prevent the application to throw some error if localStorage is not defined on SSR.

```suggestion
  if(localStorage?.getItem("theme") == undefined){
    localStorage.setItem("theme","dark")
```

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -70,6 +70,11 @@ function MyApp({ Component, pageProps }) {
 export default MyApp;
 ```
 
+#### Important Note 
+
+We Recently found an [issue](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/issues/154) with create-react-app which results in page go complete white as a temporal workaround we suggest downgrading react-scripts to version "4.0.0" from package.json file in your project directory to avoid such issue . A permanent Fix will be made soon after we found the root cause. 
+
+
 <Spacer y={2} />
 
 ### Using NextUI components

@@ -34,6 +34,9 @@ Visit <a aria-label="nextui learn" href="https://nextui.org/learn">https://nextu
 
 Visit [https://nextui.org/docs](https://nextui.org/docs) to view the full documentation.
 
+## IMPORTANT NOTE 
+Heads up Devs ! We Recently found an [issue](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/issues/154) with create-react-app causing page to go complete white when NextUI components are added to app.js file as a temporal workaround we suggest downgrading react-scripts to version "4.0.0" from package.json file to avoid such issue . A permanent Fix will be made soon after we found the root cause 
+
 ```
